description: From Middle English synagoge, from Old French synagoge, from Latin synagōga, from Ancient Greek σῠνᾰγωγή (sunagōgḗ, “assembly, gathering”), from συνάγω (sunágō, “I gather together”), from σῠ́ν (sún, “with, together”) + ᾰ̓́γω (ágō, “I lead”); surface analysis, syn- +‎ -agogue.

entries.meaning: A place of worship for Jews or Samaritans.
A congregation of Jews or Samaritans for the purpose of worship or religious study.
